sourceOfFunds.purpose: This project sanctioned for implementation of post watershed activities in completed watershed. This project activities are training and capacity building, exposures, demonstration on climate smart agriculture activities, establishment of CMRC, formation of FPC This project mainly focus on doubling the farmers income, save the natural resource, financial inclusion, promotion of livelihood activities, convergence is important

Promotion of organic farming this project activities are training and capacity building organic inputs preparation structures making production of organic food certification and marketing. This project has implemented at 7 villages of kadur taluk, 4 villages of Arasikere taluk, 4 villages of Belur taluk, 4 villages of Bellary taluk, 3 villages of Pavagada taluk, 2 villages of belthagady taluk, 2 villages of Hubli taluk 5 villages of Bhadravathi taluk, one village in sullia taluk.

This project is funded by department of agriculture for promotion of organic activities. capacity building exposure visit, input production certification of organic produces and marketing linkages is the main focus. and climate changes activities climate smart agriculture saving the natural resources in achieved in this project. this project was implement in 34 villages of 10 taluks in 7 district.

The project mainly for conservation of natural resources in Nidaghatta Sub watershed of Kadur taluk. Total 2500 Ha are treated., Capacity building, Exposures, Demonstration, Community organization activities, Soil and water conservation structures done . Promotion of livelihood activities are effectively implemented.
Spent for promotion of water and soil conservation strutures, Formation of FPO Formation of Community Managed Resource center Upgradation of Village watershed committee

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: JANASPANDANA TRUST Janaspandana Trust, established in 2009, is a non-governmental organization. It was set up in Shikaripura, a taluk head quarter in Shimoga district Karnataka state. It was started with a motive of creating and enhancing awareness on various social aspects of society among rural and urban population. The trust is actively involved in providing nursery level education to small children at various villages. The organization has started movement against female infanticide and educated the mass about dangers of such practices. To give imputes to the skills of rural youths the trust conducts job oriented training camps and personality development programmes. The trust is actively involved in training women in skills which help them become self reliant. The trust also works in the field of child labour. It has created awareness about child right and highlighted the problems and ill effects of child labour in various villages of the taluk. To safe guard the local culture, the trust actively involved in development of local art and drama culture by educating the villagers and taking them into confidence the trust conducted several cultural events. The trust knows the power of knowledge. Hence it has opened a library â€œJnana Spandanaâ€. The trust has also published 10 books on socially relevant topics. The Association prepared a memorandum on pension matters and submitted the same to V CPC on 12.7.1994. The Association had the privilege of attending the meeting with the VII Pay Commission during its visit to Bengaluru in August 2014 and submitting memoranda on pension matters to the VII CPC. The Association is nominated by the Department of Pension as a member SCOVA in the Rotating Group for a term of two years 2015-17. The Association is one of the Pensioners Associations identified by the Department of Pension and Pensioners Welfare under Pensioners Portal. Association is one of the biggest Pensioners Association in the State of Karnataka with a Membership of more than 2400. The Association publishes a monthly journal titled as Pensioners Champion. The Association has brought out a Compendium on Pension, CGHS and Medical Facilities for Central Government and BSNL Pensioners. The publication has so far seen eight editions.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: KARNATAKA SAHASA KALA ACADEMY TRUST, established in 2006 with the sole intension to impart training to unemployed youths in the field of film stunt arts and to provide job opportunities in film. We have establish a full fledged Training Centre in Ramanagar known as SAHASA KALA SHIKSHANA KENDRA and train unemployed youths to make them self-employed, We have introduced Janapada Gurukula, Adventurous Sports Hostel and a Free Study Hostel for street children, child labour of age group to 14 to 18 years. They will give training in Folk Arts, Folk Martial Arts and Folk Performing Arts Also Adventurous Sports. We are recognized from Karnataka Folklore University, Haveri. to conductt resource and development and training programme in indigenous folk martial arts. in this we are conducting 1 Year Certificate Courses in Indigenous Martial Arts and Games, Rural Tribal Youth Service and Games. Ours is a Pioneer Institute academy in India working in this field of Indigenious Martial Institution Academy in India working in this field of Indigenious Martial Art Studies since four decades. Know we want to Establish National Research and Study Centre for Indigenous Martial Arts and Allied Studies for conducting Certificate Courses U.G. & P.G. Diploma and Bachelor Degree Master Degree, M. Phil and Ph.D Program in Indigenous Martial Arts. we are already Applied to ministry of HRD Govt of India and Indiragandhi National Open University, New Delhi for recognetion. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Namma Shikshana initiatives was recognized by the Institute of Directors (IOD), as one among unique education interventions in Govt schools and was awarded the Golden Peacock National CSR Award 2020. The Govt of Karnataka in recognition of the initiative has showcased 02 of the adopted schools in their published Annual Calendar for the year 2021

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Company was incorporated during the last few days of the Financial Year i.e, on 06-03-2020

The objective of the initiative is to augment the learning outcomes of children enrolled in govt higher primary schools. KIAF has been supporting the improvement of learning ability of children in 05 govt higher primary schools adopted under the &amp;amp; School Adoption Programme of Department of Public Instruction, Govt of Karnataka. The engagement is over a period of 10 years asper the MOU entered with the department. During the year KIAF was also engaged in COVID relief activities.

The Company has identified Promotion of Education, Health, Integrated Development, Water and Sanitation, Sports and Promotion of Culture &amp; Heritage as its primary thematic work areas. The projects will be implemented under its flagship initiatives - Namma Shikshana, Namma Arogya, Namma Ooru, Namma Nela -Namma Jala, and Namma Parampare.
